section.title: ApacheCon 2004 (13-17 November 2004)
section.p: ApacheCon US 2004 (13-17 November 2004). ApacheCon is the conference for all things Apache. Come along and learn about a range of new technologies, meet some Apache folks and share the knowledge. See more information about Apache Conferences. Cliff Schmidt and Kevin Krouse are scheduled to speak about XMLBeans.

section.title: XMLBeans 1.0.3 Released (28 June 2004)
section.p: Apache XMLBeans Team has released XMLBeans Version 1.0.3. Download version 1.0.3 from the Source and Binaries section.
Version 1.0.3 is Apache XMLBeans first release after becomming a Top Level Project in the Apache Software Foundation.

section.title: XMLBeans becomes a Top Level Apache project (25 June 2004)
section.p: Apache XMLBeans Project has graduated out the Apache Incubator Project to become Top Level Project in the Apache Software Foundation. Apache XMLBeans provides a simplified model for interacting with XML documents. The project originated with a contribution from BEA Inc., however, after its time within the Apache Incubator, it is now a full-fledged Apache community and codebase under Apache License 2.0. Cliff Schmidt is the Chair of the new Apache XMLBeans PMC (Project Management Committee).

section.title: XMLBeans (incubated) 1.0.2 Released (23 April 2004)
section.p: Apache XMLBeans Team has released XMLBeans Version 1.0.2. Download version 1.0.2 from the Source and Binaries section.
Apache XMLBeans is an effort undergoing incubation at the Apache Software Foundation (ASF), sponsored by the XML project.

Incubation is required of all newly accepted projects until a further review indicates that the infrastructure, communications, and decision making process have stabilized in a manner consistent with other successful ASF projects. While incubation status is not necessarily a reflection of the completeness or stability of the code, it does indicate that the project has yet to be fully endorsed by the ASF.
